newsitem.title: JAPAN: Forex rate to settle at appropriate place soon - MOF.
newsitem.headline: Forex rate to settle at appropriate place soon - MOF.

text.p: Foreign exchange rates are likely to settle down at an appropriate place soon, to reflect economic fundamentals, Japanese Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday.
"I think that they (foreign exchange rates) will settle down at an appropriate place soon, at a place where each rate reflects economic fundamentals," Mitsuzuka said.
"An appropriate rate is desirable, keeping in mind continued stable growth without inflation," he said.
An appropriate rate will be decided by the financial markets taking into account various factors, he said.
The Group of Seven (G7) nations' statement on foreign exchange markets at their meeting in April sent out a much stronger message to the markets than previously, he said.
The G7 nations agreed to cooperate as appropriate against further violent fluctuations in currency rates, he said.

He added that Japan will deal in a timely and appropriate manner with excessive moves in currency rates. "There is no doubt that it (the G7 statement on currencies) has got through to the markets," he said.
